intro: Machaonia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered machaonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. It thrives in coastal and forested areas, often growing in well-drained soils. Machaonia pauciflora is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
